question: What % of custom duty is imposed on cars below 800cc?
answer: The % of custom duty imposed on cars below 800cc is 50%.

question: What benefits can disabled people get on importing cars?
answer: Disabled people in Pakistan can benefit from importing duty-free cars for personal use under certain conditions. These conditions include having a physical disability (excluding mental retardation/handicap and old age disability), being fit to drive a car with special gadgets, possessing a valid driving license, having a monthly income between Rs. 20,000 and Rs. 100,000, and not having imported a duty-free car before. The imported car must not exceed an engine capacity of 1,350 cc and can only be used for personal purposes, not for commercial use. Additionally, the car must be brand new, bear special registration number and color plates indicating it is for a disabled person, and cannot be sold or transferred for five years after import, except under specific conditions.

ground_truth: (i) PTA shall provide online application service whereby web-based user interface https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs/auth/login utility can be accessed by international travelers for hassle free registration and payment of duty/taxes against mobile devices imported in accompanied baggage. This utility may also be accessed through Franchise of the Cellular Mobile Operators; [For registration the international traveler can also access DIRBS by dialing Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD) Code *8484# from any mobile phone having a local SIM.](ii) The aforesaid utility will guide the applicant about the information required to be submitted for online registration of mobile devices. The system in particular will require the applicant/traveler to submit the details of passport number, Computerized national Identity Card (CNIC) number, International Motile Equipment Identity (IMEI) number etc.;(iii) 1[The above-mentioned information submitted by applicant will be auto processed/validated through WeBOC. The mobile devices will accordingly be cleared by the system in accordance with applicable rates of duty and taxes.(iv) The system shall electronically generate Payment Slip ID (PSID) for payment of duty/taxes. The applicant will then have options to pay the leviable duty/taxes through online banking, ATM, mobile banking, and bank branches of all leading.

question: What benefits can disabled people get on importing cars in Pakistan
answer: Disabled people in Pakistan can benefit from importing duty-free cars under the Disabled Persons Scheme. To be eligible, the disabled person must not be mentally retarded or handicapped, have a valid driving license, possess a monthly income between Rs. 20,000 and Rs. 100,000, and not have imported a duty-free car before. The imported car should not exceed an engine capacity of 1,350 cc and can be customized with special gadgets to compensate for the disability. Additionally, only one car can be imported per disabled person, and the car cannot be sold or transferred for five years from its arrival in Pakistan.

ground_truth: A disable person is allowed exemption of customs duty on import of new motor car of engine capacity not exceeding 1350cc, fitted with special gadgets for the purpose of compensating disability, for his own use subject to the following conditions and procedures namely:-(i) Only those disabled persons shall be entitled to import the customized cars who have been issued an import authorization certificate by the Ministry of Commerce as per criteria and conditions laid down in the Notification No. 6(I)/2009-Import-III, dated 01.09.2010, issued by the Ministry of Commerce (https://www.commerce.gov.pk/wp-content/uploads/pdf/SRO_61_2009_new.pdf);(iii) Only one car shall be allowed to be imported by a disabled person in terms of this notification.(iv) The car shall not be sold or otherwise transferred to any person before the expiry of five years from the date of its arrival in Pakistan, except under certain conditions mentioned in the aforesaid notification.

question: What is the procedure of temporary registration of phones for foreign nationals?
answer: The procedure for temporary registration of phones for foreign nationals involves accessing the web-based registration link at https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs. The applicant needs to provide credentials such as passport number, date of arrival, intended date of departure, mobile SIM issued in their name, and IMEI(s) of the device. The system will validate and verify the information in real-time, including checking if the SIM is issued in the applicant's name and verifying the date of arrival from the FIA Integrated Border Management System (IBMS). If the validation and verification are successful, the mobile device will be temporarily registered.

(iii)  The system shall carry out validation/verification on real time basis for   the entered mobile number from mobile operators to validate/verify that   the said SIM has been issued in the name of the applicant only. ground_truth: The following mechanism shall be followed for temporary registration of mobile devices in use of overseas Pakistanis/ Foreigners (including those working abroad or Pakistani students studying aboard) visiting Pakistan on short term visits through web-based registration available at link https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs(i) This temporary /registration facilitation module for overseas Pakistanis/ Foreigners will be applicable for only one (1) mobile handset device.(ii) To avail this facility, the applicant shall provide his/her credentials including passport No., date of arrival and intended date of departure, mobile SIM issued in his/her name, IMEI(s) of the device.(iii) The system shall carry out validation/verification on real time basis for the entered mobile number from mobile operators to validate/verify that the said SIM has been issued in the name of the applicant only. In case of non-validation/non-verification, the application will not be processed any further.(iv) The system shall carry out real time validation from FIA Integrated Border Management System (IBMS) to verify the date of arrival of applicant. In case of non-validation/non-verification, the application shall not be processed any further.(v) Upon these validations/verifications from FIA and Mobile Operators, the application shall be processed, and the applied IMEI(s) will be paired with the applied mobile number. This will allow mobile service with the declared SIM/mobile number only and in case of insertion of any other SIM, the device shall not allow any network connectivity.(vi) An IMEI which has been applied once for this facility if applied again by using another person's passport, the same IMEI shall not be allowed this facility and will require the device to be registered as per prevailing procedures of payment of applicable duty and taxes.(vii) On lapse of 120 days, the IMEI(s) utilized under this facility shall be blacklisted and shall not be allowed local network services.(viii) In case, the same applicant visits Pakistan again, he/she will be required to re-apply for this temporary facility with the same credentials which were used for the 1St or previous registration under this scheme. Furthermore, all above stated checks will be re-verified from FIA and Mobile operators for the said temporary registration.

question: What is the custom duty on products imported from China?
answer: The customs duty on products imported from China varies depending on the specific product being imported. The rates mentioned in the document range from 5% for certain agricultural products to higher slabs such as 15% for other goods. It is important to refer to the specific PCT code of the product to determine the exact customs duty percentage.

ground_truth: For the purpose of implementing Rule 8(b) of the China-Pakistan FTA Rules of Origin, where transportation is affected through the territory outside the two member states, the following shall be produced to the Government authorities of the importing Member State:(a) A through Bill of Lading issued in the exporting Member State.(b) A Certificate of Origin issued by the relevant Government authorities of the exporting Member State.(d) A copy of the original commercial invoice in respect of the product: and(e) Supporting documents in evidence that the requirements of Rule 8(b) sub-paragraphs (i), (ii) and (iii) of the China-Pakistan FTA Rules ofOrigin are being complied with.
